perturbation.original_text: Within 15 business days after the date hereof, Party B will pay RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: Within 60 business days after the date hereof, Party B will pay RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the initial payment to 60 business days could create inconsistencies if standard commercial practices or regulations in PRC mandate a quicker payment timeframe, potentially violating typical payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates standard commercial practices or regulations in PRC regarding reasonable payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: Within 15 business days after the end of the first cooperation period, Party B will pay another RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: At Party B's discretion after the end of the first cooperation period, Party B may pay another RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Making the second payment discretionary introduces uncertainty and contradicts the original fixed payment schedule. This violates the principle of 'consideration' in contract law, where both parties must provide something of value. Under PRC Contract Law, contracts must clearly define the obligations of each party, and this change makes Party B's payment obligation ambiguous and unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC Contract Law regarding consideration and clear definition of contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Party B will respond to any complaint within a reasonable upon receipt thereof, which response process is subject to approval of Party A. If Party B receives any complaint of any third party regarding the tort or breach of any content in the Cooperation channel which is forwarded from Party A, Party B will delete such content within 24 hours or notify Party A of its responsive measures.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B will respond to any complaint at their earliest convenience. If Party B receives any complaint of any third party regarding the tort or breach of any content in the Cooperation channel which is forwarded from Party A, Party B will delete such content within 72 hours.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the response time to complaints to 'earliest convenience' provides no definite answer for the other parties. Delaying content removal related to torts to 72 hours may not satisfy legal requirements in the PRC for prompt action in cases of defamation, copyright infringement, or other illegal content, potentially leading to legal liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC laws regarding liability for illegal content and prompt action in cases of defamation or copyright infringement.
